thread.title: Yves Béhar’s High-Tech Home Is Where You’ll Want To Live
thread.title_full: Yves Béhar’s High-Tech Home Is Where You’ll Want To Live

author: Brian Farmer
title: Yves Béhar’s High-Tech Home Is Where You’ll Want To Live
text:
Yves Behar is the founder and principal designer of San Francisco and New York-based Fuseproject — an award-winning industrial design and branding firm.
The renowned Swiss designer recently showcased a tour of his residence, situated on a steep hill in the Cow Hollow neighborhood of San Francisco. Embodying minimalist and contemporary sensibilities, the three-story home boasts a blacked-out facade as a stark contrast to its traditional neighbors.
With the idea of “design is humanistic,” Behar’s home aimed to “create experiences that are a lot more magical, without the least amount of effort.” A blend of material and textures prominent throughout the interior and exterior invite touch, as well as functionality with the implementation of technology. A standout feature consists of doors unlocking when approached.
Filled with contemporary art, alongside objects acquired from adventures, in addition to political statements that promote peace — each element in the home serves functionality as well as personal significance.
In case you missed it, Yves Behar’s design contribution is also evident on the upcoming Samsung Frame TV .
